details: Serving as a research and development substitute service (RDSS) engineer, participating in full-stack development across government-related maritime information platforms.
Implemented frontend features using Vue, Kendo UI, and legacy cshtml Razor pages, ensuring smooth migration and compatibility between new and existing systems.
Developed backend services using .NET (C#) as the primary stack, supplemented with Python-based FastAPI microservices for automation, data processing, and API integrations.
Designed and managed databases in both MSSQL and PostgreSQL, including schema design, stored procedures, query optimization, and data migration planning based on system analysis (SA) documentation.
Handled deployment and infrastructure tasks involving IIS configuration, CI/CD pipelines, Docker image builds, and server-side troubleshooting to ensure stable production releases.

Collaborated with cross-functional teams to deliver end-to-end features—from system analysis and architecture planning, to development, testing, documentation, release, and post-deployment maintenance.

Worked under the supervision of Prof. Henryk A. Witek, a Polish-born theoretical chemist specializing in quantum chemistry, applied linear algebra, and perturbation theory. All research communication and documentation were conducted in English.
Developed mathematical and computational tools for studying quantum systems, with a focus on electronic structure theory and numerical methods for solving multi-electron problems.

Designed and implemented numerical routines and simulation workflows that supported my master’s thesis Techniques for computing energy eigenvalues in quantum systems: sextic anharmonic oscillator and electrons on a 4D hypersphere (PDF), improving both computational accuracy and efficiency.

Implemented high-performance numerical computations primarily using Julia and Maple to handle symbolic expressions, algebraic manipulation, and large-scale iterative calculations, with Python and Linux tooling used to automate workflows and manage computational tasks.
Prepared the full thesis manuscript using LaTeX, integrating mathematical derivations, visualization outputs, and numerical results into a coherent scientific document.
experience.location: National Yang Ming Chiao Tung University

details: Conducted research under Prof. Chin-Fa Lee, a well-known scholar in organometallic catalysis and former department chair.
Focused on experimental design, organic synthesis, methodology development, and reaction optimization to identify effective catalytic systems.
Processed and visualized analytical data using Origin and MATLAB, including results obtained from GC-MS and HPLC, for quantitative and qualitative chemical analysis.
Developed practical laboratory skills in synthesis planning, catalyst evaluation, reaction monitoring, and scientific data interpretation.
